docs.lead_paragraph: One out of every twenty doctors in the United States suffers from a psychiatric disturbance severe enough to damage his or her ability to care properly for patients, the American Medical Association has estimated.

headline.main: The Doctors Who Need the Care of Other Doctors

docs.abstract: Article on changing attitudes of organized med to drs who are psychiatrically disturbed; Dr Herbert A Raskin says drs seem more vulnerable to mental troubles than other occupational groups; drawing (M)
docs.snippet: One out of every twenty doctors in the United States suffers from a psychiatric disturbance severe enough to damage his or her ability to care properly for patients, the American Medical Association has estimated.
